{{Infobox software | name = Pixel Image Editor | logo = <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Pixel icon48.png|48px|Mac Icon]] --> | screenshot = [[Image:Pixel-osx.png|250px|Screenshot of Pixel image editor running in [[Mac OS X]].]] | caption = Screenshot of Pixel image editor run in [[Mac OS X]]. | developer = Pavel Kanzelsberger | latest_release_version = Pixel 1.0 Beta 8 build 740 | latest_release_date = {{start date and age|2009|10|21}} | programming language = [[Object Pascal]]: [[Free Pascal]] | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | genre = [[Raster graphics editor]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] | website = {{URL|http://www.kanzelsberger.com}} (dead) }} '''Pixel Image Editor''' (formerly known as Pixel Studio Pro and Pixel32) is an [[Image editor]] written by the [[Slovakia|Slovak]] programmer Pavel Kanzelsberger.<ref>James Gray. [http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/9710 Interview with Pavel Kanzelsberger], LinuxJournal (July 1, 2007)</ref> It is written with [[Free Pascal]].
==Features== Pixel supports [[grayscale]], [[RGB color model|RGB]], [[CMYK color model|CMYK]], [[Lab color space|CIE Lab]] and [[High dynamic range imaging|HDR]] image models, [[color management]], [[2D computer graphics#Layers|layers]], adjustment layers, layer effects, filter effects, [[web page]] authoring, photo retouching and animations.
Planned future functionality includes batch file processing, user scripting (to chain multiple effects), a third-party plugin [[Application programming interface|API]] and support for files as large as 65536 x 65536 pixels.<ref>Willis, Nathan. [http://www.linux.com/article.pl?sid=05/12/06/1828230 Review: Pixel image editor], [[Linux.com]] (December 15, 2005)</ref>
The evaluation version places watermarks on images and can be used for an unlimited amount of time.
==Current version== After almost a year of anticipation the Beta7 was published on 28 August 2007. The last time the final version was announced to released was on 30 April 2009, however only maintenance version was released on 21 October 2009.
==Platforms== The first version of Pixel was written for [[DOS]] in 1997, but it was soon ported to [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. Today, Pixel runs on many [[computing platform|platform]]s including:
* [[ARM architecture|ARM]] * [[PowerPC]] * [[SPARC]] * [[x86]], [[x86-64]]
and more than a dozen [[operating system]]s including:
* [[BeOS]]-[[Magnussoft ZETA|ZETA]]/x86 * [[DOS]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] * [[eComStation]] * [[MorphOS]]/PPC * [[OS/2]] * [[SkyOS]] * [[Unix-like]] ** [[FreeBSD]]/x86 ** [[GNU]]/[[Linux]]/x86/PPC ** [[Mac OS X]]/x86/PPC ** [[QNX]]/x86
The current version is however only released for Windows, Mac OS and Linux, it is currently unknown if it will be published on any other platforms.
==Controversy== Pixel has been developed for nearly 13 years<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://www.kanzelsberger.com/pixel/?page_id=7 Pixel image editor - About], [[Pixel image editor]] (2009)</ref> with no final release ever published. It has been sold on the web as a preview-release/release candidate since the year 2000 for different prices ranging from 20-50 USD.<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://web.archive.org/web/20000619033058/pixel32.box.sk/enter.php3 Secundum Artem - Pixel32], [[Secundum Artem]] (June 2000)</ref> It was stated on its website in 2000 that "Final version is expected to be released in March or April 2000. We are working also on BeOS and Linux ports of Pixel32."<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://web.archive.org/web/20000619033058/pixel32.box.sk/enter.php3 Secundum Artem - Pixel32], [[Secundum Artem]] (June 2000)</ref> Since then, a final release has been scheduled on several occasions but never met. It was stated on its website in 2005 that it would have its "final beta testing in AugustâDecember 2005."<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://web.archive.org/web/20060103013400/www.kanzelsberger.com/pixel/?page_id=7 Pixel image editor - About, [[Pixel image editor]] (2005)</ref> and a "final stable product will be released in 2006",<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://web.archive.org/web/20060513093636/www.kanzelsberger.com/pixel/?page_id=7 Pixel image editor - About, [[Pixel image editor]] (2006)</ref> as well as in 2007.<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://web.archive.org/web/20070202155517/www.kanzelsberger.com/pixel/?page_id=7 Pixel image editor - About, [[Pixel image editor]] (2007)</ref> On September 15, 2008 it was stated that the final version would be released on the 30th of April 2009, although it was not released on this day.<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://www.kanzelsberger.com/pixel/?p=88 Pixel image editor - About, [[Pixel 1.0 final release]] (September 15th 2008)</ref> The final release of Pixel was later stated to be ready in the first quarter of 2010,<ref>[http://www.kanzelsberger.com/pixel/?page_id=7 Kanzelsberger, Pavel]</ref> it was however not released at this date and no news has been published since. Meanwhile, the author has a tendency not to communicate with his users. The forum is shut down completely and comments need approval before being published on the website.<ref>Kanzelsberger, Pavel. [http://pixelcommunity.com/forum/ Pixel image editor - Forum, [[Forum disabled]] (December 29th 2009)</ref>
